notes: Northern Ireland does NOT have prescribed official PDF forms like Scotland or England & Wales. Documents are generated from templates that meet legal requirements.

notice_seeking_possession.doc.title: Notice Seeking Possession (Reference Template)
notice_seeking_possession.doc.notes: Department for Communities reference template. Used as guidance for creating compliant notices. No prescribed mandatory form exists in NI law.

notice_to_quit.title: Notice to Quit
notice_to_quit.legal_basis: Common law notice to terminate tenancy
notice_to_quit.notice_period: 28 days minimum (4/8/12 weeks based on tenancy length)
requirements: Must specify termination date (end of rental period)
Must include landlord and tenant details
Can be delivered in person, by post, email or text

notice_of_intention.title: Notice of Intention to Seek Possession
requirements: Must include full particulars of each ground
Must be served after or with Notice to Quit
Must state landlord intends to apply to court
Must classify grounds as mandatory or discretionary

claim_summary.title: County Court Claim Summary (Guidance Only)
claim_summary.notes: Actual court claims ('ejectment civil bills') must be prepared by solicitors. We provide guidance and document summaries only.
requirements: Must include all evidence supporting grounds
